brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of our study is to investigate the effects of high-protein diet on satiety and
      incretin hormones in patients with diabetes.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Jeju Red Horsehead Fish-based, High Protein Diet on Satiety and Incretin Hormones in Diabetes Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diabetes mellitus

          -  Subjects signed a written informed consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Liver cirrhosis

          -  Chronic renal disease (serum creatinine > 2mg/dL)

          -  Severe congestive heart failure

          -  Significant infectious or inflammatory diseases

          -  intractable malignant neoplasm

          -  Pregnancy

intervention.description:
The high-protein diet is made up of 50% carbohydrate, 40% of protein and 10% of fat, providing 480 kcal.
A protein part of the high-protein diet is mostly composed of a grilled Jeju red horsehead fish, a special product of Jeju island in Korea.
intervention.other_name: A Jeju red horsehead fish-based meal

intervention.description: The standard diet is made up of 60% carbohydrate, 20% of protein and 20% of fat, providing 480 kcal.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Jeju Red Horsehead Fish-based, High Protein Diet on Satiety and Incretin Hormones in Diabetes Patients

other_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
other_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for glucose after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

other_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
other_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for insulin after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

other_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
other_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for C-peptide after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

other_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
other_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for glucagon after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

primary_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
primary_outcome.measure: Difference in the incremental area under the curve (iAUC) for peptide YY (PYY) after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for cholecystokinin (CCK) after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for ghrelin after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for glucagon-like peptide 1 (GLP-1) after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were drawn before the test meal (time 0) and at 30, 60, 90, 120, and 180 min after the test meal commenced.
secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the iAUC for glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) after food ingestion between high-protein and standard diet groups

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
